entry.title: Error 404 with variants /sap/bc/lrep/actions/getcsrftoken/
entry.content:
Hello,

I've created an app with Fiori elements, and it was deployed in Cloud Foundry and Work Zone. When I tested the app in BAS it worked well, and I was able to save variants, but when I deployed it, variants didn't work. When I try to create a variant appears the next error.

I debug this error with the console, and I found the next:

I've checked the manifest.json file and it has the library sap.ui.fl. I've created a destination in BTP for the path /sap/bc/lrep/ and the problem persists. I don't know what else to do 😥

I hope your knowledge let me solve this problem.

entry.title: Pasar identificador unico de usuario desde app móvil a app SAPUI5 embebida
entry.content:
Hola a todos,
Quisiera pedirles ayuda a quienes hayan logrado algo similar y me puedan orientar.

Tengo un desarrollo web hecho con SAPUI5 , el cual ya está listo y embebido dentro de una aplicación móvil . El flujo es el siguiente:

  • El usuario accede primero a la aplicación móvil.

  • En ese ingreso, la aplicación móvil captura la cédula del usuario (como identificador único).

  • Luego, dentro de esa misma aplicación móvil, se carga la aplicación SAPUI5 embebida.

Lo que necesito es que, al momento de ingresar a la aplicación web, esta pueda recibir esa cédula enviada desde la aplicación móvil , para que el desarrollo haga automáticamente un filtro de datos y muestre la información correspondiente al usuario.

Agradezco mucho si alguien ha realizado este tipo de integración y puede compartirme cómo lo logró o qué debo tener en cuenta.

Saludos

entry.title: Fiori Elements: Display Tree-Structure using OData Annotation (Code Based)
entry.content:
Hello,

I want to create a Tree Table with Fiori Elements using SEGW, but I'm not able to do so.

I try to follow this posts:
Fiori Elements: Display Tree-Structure using OData... - SAP Community
Fiori Elements Tree Table with SAP Annotations - SAP Community

This is my data table:

This are the fields:

 

These are my CDS Views:

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

@EndUserText.label: 'Intermediate View for Tree Structure'

define view entity ZCDS_I_TREE_STRUCTURE

as select from ztree_table

{

key id,

parentid,

hierlevel,

drilldownstate,

nodename,

nodedescription

}

 

@EndUserText.label: 'Konsumptions-View für ZTREE_TABLE'

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED

//@OData.publish: true

@UI.headerInfo: {

typeName: 'Knoten',

typeNamePlural: 'Knoten'

}

@Hierarchy.parentChild: [{

name: 'TreeHierarchy',

recurse: {

parent: ['parentid'],

child: ['id']

},

siblingsOrder: [{

by: 'nodename',

direction: #ASC

}],

rootNode: {

visibility: #ADD_ROOT_NODE_IF_DEFINED

},

orphanedNode: {

handling: #ROOT_NODES

}

}]

define view entity ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTURE

as select from ZCDS_I_TREE_STRUCTURE

{

 

key id,

parentid,

hierlevel,

drilldownstate,

@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 10, label: 'Node Name' }]

nodename,

@UI.lineItem: [{ position: 20, label: 'Node Description' }]

nodedescription

}

 

 

In SEGW I created a project and the did a right click on "Data Model"  then "Reference" / "Data Source" and chose my ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTURE. Icreated the runtime objects and redefined the method "define" in my *MPC_EXT class with the following code:


METHOD define.
  super->define( ).

  DATA: lr_entity    TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_entity_typ,
        lr_property  TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_property,
        lr_annotation TYPE REF TO /iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotation.

  lr_entity = model->get_entity_type( iv_entity_name = 'ZCDS_C_TREE_STRUCTUREType' ).
  IF lr_entity IS BOUND.

    " 1. id als Knoten-ID
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'id' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_node_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 2. RELATKEY als Parent Node
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'parentid' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_parent_node_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 3. SeqNo als Hierarchieebene
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'hierlevel' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_level_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

    " 4. drill_state als Drill-Down-Zustand
    lr_property = lr_entity->get_property( iv_property_name = 'drilldownstate' ).
    lr_annotation = lr_property->/iwbep/if_mgw_odata_annotatabl~create_annotation(
                        iv_annotation_namespace = /iwbep/if_mgw_med_odata_types=>gc_sap_namespace ).
    lr_annotation->add(
        iv_key = /iwbep/if_ana_odata_types=>gcs_ana_odata_annotation_key-hierarchy_drill_state_for
        iv_value = 'id' ).

  ENDIF.
ENDMETHOD.

If I create then the Responsive Table in the BAS, it shows me my data correctly. When I change to type "TreeTable", it shows me "No data found".

What am I doing wrong?

Thanks and best regards
Thomas

@MR_srinivas 
@SumitKundu 
@jmalla

entry.title: CAP + SAPUI5 - How does auth work?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I am currently developing an application with the following components:

- CAP backend,

- FE Frontend

- Several SAPUI5 (Freestyle) Frontends

Up until now I have only used auth: mocked or dummy. This way, the connections between front- and backend have worked seamlessly. Now, after having deployed my SAPUI5 frontends to the HTML5 repo and trying to do POST requests against the backend I get a 403 - forbidden response (works however in BAS dev env and Postman) - also the GET requests from the very same SAPUI5 Apps work. I have done some research on this and most articles were suggesting CORS / CSRF issues but I also read that this is handled automatically by the SAPUI5 Framework. Further research suggested that deployed apps require proper token based authentication, which is why I am trying to setup XSUAA now. However, I am having a hard time wrapping my head around this as to what is exactly required for my frontends, backend, managed approuter,..etc.. Thus, I am asking you for some guidance regarding these topics / my issue. 

Regards,

Oliver

entry.title: How to Use NPM Modules Like crypto-js in SAPUI5 Using UI5 Tooling Modules
entry.content:
Use NPM Modules in SAPUI5 on Cloud Foundry with UI5 Tooling (crypto-js Example)

Ever wanted to use modern JavaScript libraries like crypto-js in your SAPUI5 project? You're in the right place.

With the help of ui5-tooling-modules, you can now seamlessly integrate NPM modules into your UI5 apps—no hacks or copy-pasting needed.

Let’s unlock powerful encryption, hashing, and token generation in a few simple steps! 🚀

Note: This method is designed for use inside controller files (or any AMD-style module). You cannot use require() or top-level import syntax like in standard Node.js or modern frontend frameworks.

Prerequisites

  • Node.js installed

  • SAPUI5/Fiori Tools CLI
  • UI5 Tooling v3

    Step 1: Create a Basic SAPUI5 Project

    Use the SAP Fiori Tools or Yeoman generator.

    • Template: Basic

    • Data Source: None
    • Attributes: Default

      Ensure index.html looks something like this:

       <script
                   id="sap-ui-bootstrap"
                  src="resources/sap-ui-core.js"
                  data-sap-ui-theme="sap_horizon"
                  data-sap-ui-resourceroots='{ "your.project.namespace":               "./" }'
                  data-sap-ui-         oninit="module:sap/ui/core/ComponentSupport"

                 data-sap-ui-async="true" data-sap-ui- frameOptions="trusted" /> 

       

      Step 2: Install ui5-tooling-modules

      In your project root:


      npm install --save-dev ui5-tooling-modules

      ✅UI5  Tooling v3 handles module resolution—no need to add ui5.dependencies manually.

    • 🔒Step 3: Install crypto-js


      npm install --save-dev crypto-js

    • Step 4: Use crypto-js in Your Controller

      You can now use the npm module in any controller like this: 

       

      sap.ui.define([
      "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller",
      "crypto-js/sha256"
      ], function(Controller, SHA256) {
      "use strict";
      return Controller.extend("your.project.namespace.controller.Main", { onInit: function () {
      var message = "Hello UI5!";
      var hash = SHA256(message).toString();
      console.log("SHA256 Hash:", hash);
               }
          });
      });
      Reminder: This pattern only works inside controllers or AMD modules. You cannot use npm modules globally in your app or with require() outside of SAPUI5’s module system.

      Step 5: Configure ui5.yaml

      builder:
            customTasks:
                        - name: ui5-tooling-modules-task
                           afterTask: replaceVersion
      server:
             customMiddleware:
                 - name: ui5-tooling-modules-middleware                                             afterMiddleware: compression
                  - name: fiori-tools-proxy
                   afterMiddleware: ui5-tooling-modules-middleware

    • Step 6: Run and Test

      Start the app using:

      npm run start-noflp

      Open DevTools → Console. You should see the SHA256 hash logged.

       

      Why Use crypto-js in SAPUI5?

      • Modern encryption, hashing, and token generation

      • No external script tags or CDNs
      • Works natively with AMD modules in SAPUI5
      • TypeScript-friendly
      • Perfect for using NPM modules inside controllers

        Final Thoughts

        Thanks to ui5-tooling-modules, integrating npm packages like crypto-js is clean and stable. While it’s limited to controller (or AMD module) scope, that’s often enough for most enterprise UI logic.
        Whether you’re building internal tools or customer apps, this setup empowers you to use modern JS libraries safely within the SAPUI5 ecosystem.

entry.title: Adaptation Project for Post Outgoing Payment (F1612)
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I'm working on an adaptation project for the "Post Outgoing Payments" (F1612) Fiori app. The adaptation project works fine in Preview and in the Adaptation Editor, but after deployment, launching the app shows a blank page.

Here’s the error shown in the browser console:
Uncaught (in promise) Unknown consumer of clearing library: <my namespace>
I haven’t made any modifications—just created the adaptation project and deployed it as-is. I expected it to load like the default app, but instead, I’m getting this blank screen.

For context, I'm using VS Code and have tried both the @SAP-ux/generator-adp and @SAP/generator-adaptation-project to generate the project. The result is the same in both cases.

Has anyone experienced something similar? Is there a workaround or specific configuration required to enable adaptation for this app?

Thanks in advance for your help!

entry.title: How to make ui5 scrollbar visible on focus?
entry.content:
I have a dashboard which has a sidebar component visible on click of a button on main dashboard. On the sidebar, i can add some elements (use-case based). When the number of elements are too many, scrollbar comes into use by default.

I want to make it such that the scrollbar is visible only when hovering over or interacting with components in the sidebar.

How to achieve this? I tried focusable=true but that doesn't work.

entry.title: ECPAO_EE_VIEWER - delete/clear failed employee replications
entry.content:
Hi,

we have implemented the SuccessFactors integration in our S4HANA System.

At the beginning we did some tests and therefore we have in the ECPAO_EE_VIEWER a lot of failed entries with errors we don't want to solve because they are not really applicable to our business scenarios.

However, I have not find any way to delete or clear these "failed" employees replications.

Is there any way to delete/clear these failed entries so we don't see them anymore in ECPAO_EE_VIEWER until we try to process/replicate them again?

entry.title: CI-DS - Data visibility in IBP is not correct
entry.content:
My requirement is to load the data into the keyfigure using the master data file. so I created keyfiguredate as 20250101, 20260101 to avoid making the file too big (for example PRD1 LOC1 SourceID1 combination will have 156 lines and so on).

As my key figure disaggregation mode is 'COPY VALUE' so it should just copy across the entire horizon, which is working fine when i upload the data manually through Data integration app by selecting year in Key figure and data is disaggregated to Week level

When I use CI-DS to upload the file. in IBP, it is not showing up at technical week level. 

Is it possible somehow through CI-DS?

I am using query mapping as (to_date(to_char(FILE_EXPORT_COMP_COEFFICIENT.KEYFIGUREDATE, 'YYYYMMDD'), 'YYYYMMDD')) and transformation mapping (ifthenelse(QueryAndFilter.KEYFIGUREDATE is NULL, sysdate(), QueryAndFilter.KEYFIGUREDATE - day_in_week(QueryAndFilter.KEYFIGUREDATE) + 1), also using the global parameter in the execution properties as '$G_TIME_PROFILE_LEVEL = '2' (Time profile id - Week Technical) but can't see the data at technical week level.

entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

I don' see any BAPI for the same as system only allows 12-13 line item postings for the settlement rule.

Please advise soon as it affects our month-end processes.

Regards,

Amit Dugar

entry.title: Stock not transferred from ROD storage location after SMQ2 error solving
entry.content:
We have a SAP S4 set-up with embedded EWM. We have a ROD (received on dock) storage location and an AFS (available for sale) storage location in our EWM. So as long as the putaway warehouse tasks aren't confirmed, the stock remains in the ROD storage location. When we then confirm the warehouse tasks, the stock is moved with a transfer order and movement type 411 automatically to storage location AFS. 

When something goes wrong on the inbound flow, and we need to reprocess an inbound delivery that got stuck in the SMQ2 error queue (note that we solve the error queue, and not just save the LUW to SMQ3!), we experience that our automatic 411 transfer from the ROD storage location to the AFS storage location does not happen anymore. Probably because the warehouse tasks that trigger it, had already been confirmed. 

Does anyone have any experience in how to solve this?

entry.title: SAP Signavio Process insights
entry.content: Can we see which processes are yet to be analysed by Signavio process insights using admin access in BTP cockpit. If not how to see the data which is yet to be analysed by the Signavio process insights system.

entry.title: -dbg.js Files Still Generated Despite Exclusion in ui5-deploy.yaml
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm running into an issue when building my UI5 application for production using a custom ui5-deploy.yaml. Despite having properly configured the exclusion of debug files (*-dbg.js and *-dbg.controller.js), they are still being generated in the dist folder.

Current ui5-deploy.yaml configuration:

Build command:

ui5 build --config=ui5-deploy.yaml --clean-dest --dest dist

 

Even with the excludes configuration, debug files like *-dbg.controller.js are still present in the build output (dist folder). This is unexpected for a production build.

Is there something I might be missing in the configuration?
Could any custom task or builder step be reintroducing the -dbg.js files?

Any help or insight would be greatly appreciated

 

Regards

entry.title: Hosting modified SAPUI5 resources
entry.content:
Hi,

We have these scenarios where we need to host OpenUI5 and/or SAPUI5 apps together with their own clones of the runtime repositories:

  1. App runs in an offline network, i.e. the clients accessing it cannot reach https://ui5.sap.com/resources from where we usually provision the runtimes.
  2. Apps can deploy online to BTP as usual, but we need to modify standard libraries. Specific example is to adjust the Fiori Elements templating process beyond what is supported in the Flexible Programming Model.

For 1.) I expect the approach would involve hosting the runtimes from https://tools.hana.ondemand.com/#sapui5 together with the app.

For 2.) I expect it would involve cloning, adjusting, building and deploying https://github.com/UI5/openui5 for OpenUI5 since it is open source, but how about SAPUI5? It would also be great to only host the particular portion of the runtime which needs adjustment (e.g. sap.fe), and convenient if the hosting could still be into the HTML5 repo and still integrate with the managed launchpad.

Has anyone tried this and have guidance, samples, best practices etc. to share?

Thanks in advance!

//Carl

entry.title: Navigation Issue in CAP UI5 Apps on BTP CF Fiori Launchpad After Page Refresh
entry.content:
Hi all,

We are building several CAP-based UI5 applications deployed on BTP Cloud Foundry.

When these applications run inside the Fiori Launchpad (FLP), we encounter a navigation issue: if a user refreshes the page explicitly, they are unable to navigate back using either the browser’s back button or the Launchpad’s NavBack button (next to the SAP home icon). Initially, the user remains stuck on the current page (the browser hash doesn’t change either). After a few clicks, they are suddenly redirected straight to the FLP home page.

There are no errors/warnings/info in the browser's console log.

This issue does not occur when the same UI5 apps are run in standalone mode (accessed via the HTML5 Applications tab in the BTP Cockpit), nor does it affect Fiori Elements apps running in FLP.

Here’s how we handle navigation and routing in our UI5 app view controllers (TypeScript):

Navigating Forward

// params are routing parameters such as mandatory parameter
public navToView(viewName: string, params?: object): void {
    this.getRouter().navTo(viewName, params ? params : {});
}

Example usage:

public onNavToNextView(): void {
    this.navToView("nextView");
}

We even added a nav back button, but it has the same problem as well.

Navigating Back

// same, params is just an obj for routing parameters
public navBackToView(viewName: string, params?: object): void {
    const history = History.getInstance();
    const previousHash = history.getPreviousHash();

    if (previousHash !== undefined) {
        window.history.go(-1);
    } else {
        this.getRouter().navTo(viewName, params ? params : {}, true);
    }
}

Example usage:

// press event for nav back button
public onNavBack(): void {
    this.navBackToView("previousView");
}

This is how we initialise the router in the Component.ts file:

this.getRouter().initialize();

This is the routing configuration in the manifest.json file:

"routing": {
      "config": {
        "routerClass": "sap.m.routing.Router",
        "controlAggregation": "pages",
        "controlId": "app",
        "transition": "slide",
        "type": "View",
        "viewType": "XML",
        "path": "myapp.view",
        "async": true,
        "bypassed": {
          "target": "notFound"
        }
      },
      "routes": [
        {
          "name": "RouteHome",
          "pattern": ":?query:",
          "target": ["TargetHome"]
        },
        {
          "pattern": "login",
          "name": "login",
          "target": "login"
        }
      ],
      "targets": {
        "TargetHome": {
          "id": "Home",
          "name": "Home",
          "level": 1
        },
        "login": {
          "viewName": "Login",
          "viewId": "login",
          "level": 1
        },
        "notFound": {
          "id": "notFound",
          "name": "NotFound",
          "transition": "show"
        }
      }
    }

 

Are we missing something in our implementation? We’ve followed UI5 examples from the Demo Kit. Could this be a known or unknown issue/bug with FLP itself?

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you.

entry.title: Setting Default Values in Create-Dialog
entry.content:
Hi,

I'm relatively new to the topic of SAPUI5 and Fiori development.

My first litlle project is creating an app variant of  a Fiori standard app (F5241). I wanted to implement these requirements via an Fiori Adaptation Project. It should contain less fields on the Object Page and the fields "Order Type", "Planning Plant" and "Main Work Center" should have default values that are not editable for the users. Because of the fields "Order Type" and "Planning Plant" already being set in the Create-Dialog, I want to know if you have any solutions to set a default value for fields in this Create-Dialog. 

 

I would be very thankful if you can help me with that. Thank!

Best regards,

Max
